content:
Thunderbird for Android does not have address book on its own.

You can post feature request in the following forum: https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/idb-p/ideas/label-name/thunderbird%20android

There is the same feature request in the above forum already, and you can upvote them: an address book in Thunderbird for android https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/an-address-book-in-thunderbird-for-android/idi-p/84952
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content:
1. "Settings" > "General settings" > "Notifications" > untick "Disable notifications" and untick "Quiet time".

2. (I am not sure whether this step is necessary or not) (Still in "Notifications") "Lock Screen Notifications" > choose the option you like.

3. "Settings" > tap the account you want to configure > "Notifications" > tick "New mail notifications" and configure "New mail ringtone", "Vibration" and "Notification light".

4. (Still in "Notifications") "Notification categories" section > "Messages" > configure notifications here.

---

If the above steps do not help you, then it is beyond my knowledge, and I cannot help you further. I am sorry.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content:
The following steps might be helpful:

Click three horizontal bars on the top left corner > tap the account you want to configure > "Manage folders" > tap the folder you want to configure > turn on "Notifications".
creator: Yu5tiqX9og
